body:
* [x] normal commands
* [x] some misuse of serv.world

comment_data.body: well idk if modpe api is implementable with an async representation. That causes bug in the current implementation
ModPe needs to have returns, patching user scripts to add support for async is impossible.

- some misuse of serv.world
Explain, I do not understand.
It's possible using deasync for a very stupid, naive implementation that blocks the event-loop.
Yeah, it's written on c++ though, but if modpe is a plugin, I guess that's ok
alright, now you can use [prismarine-world-sync](https://github.com/PrismarineJS/prismarine-world-sync/blob/master/example.js#L26) to implement modpe @Creeplays
Some scripts will dont work because of not full modpe impl.

Sure. What I am asking is : what works ? (for example : what works in world edit ?)

(you can test world edit in rom1504.fr btw)
I'm thinking a better way to fix this might be to automatically convert the modpe scripts to make them support the async api. Not sure how hard that would be, maybe not too hard.
@rom1504 well, using something like esprima, you could go through the javascript AST, find the function calls, and try async-ifying them. It'd probably be a bit hard, but not impossible.
Yeah, I think transforming adding await to the function calls (and async to the functions) and then transpiling them with babel might do it.
Rom, I don't known what version of worldedit you at using. There is alot of it, created by random peoples, and all have antworer function set.

I'm using the one you put on one of your pull request.

https://github.com/Creeplays/flying-squid/blob/e7095a00a977a2fee3ee1698536ff5b28d451cf5/lib/modpePlugins/we.js
In this we works all, selection are accessible in creative (setItem packet handles only creative) using wooden axe.
Ticking is not fully working, movePacket = tick for modpe.
Can you explain what you mean?
this was done some time ago
Ah actually, letting it open for "a better way to fix this might be to automatically convert the modpe scripts to make them support the async api"
Now that plugins are done, do we still need this open since it can be made into a plugin?
I'll move it to modpe plugin repo once it's done

title: modpe and async
